question: The "Wolf Volcano" is located in which country?
explanation: The Wolf Volcano, also known as Mount Whiton, is an active stratovolcano located in the Galapagos Islands under the administration of Ecuador. This volcanic mountain, which is 1707 metres high above sea level, is the highest peak in the Galapagos Islands and an ultra prominent peak. As in common in the Galapagos, Wolf Volcano has unique fauna, differing from not only the other islands in the group but also its neighbouring volcanoes on the same island.
